alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 6:11PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Marion and northern Lamar Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 611 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beaverton, or 8 miles northeast of Sulligent. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Sulligent, Guin, Brilliant, Detroit, Beaverton, Gu- Win, Lamar County Airport, Crews, Twin, Henson Springs, Pearces Mill, Rankin Fite Airport, Byrd, Pine Springs, Marion County Public Lake and Pikeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
